Package: com.adamweigold.lemming

[Groovy] Class Lemming<T>

    • com.adamweigold.lemming.Lemming

    • Provides a builder pattern for asynchronously collecting results from one or more java.util.concurrent.Callables.

      This can be invoked in the following manner from Java: 

       Lemming<Collected> lemming = Lemming.makeLemming();
 Collection<Collected> results = lemming.add(new Callable<Collected>() {
     public Collected call() throws Exception {
       return new Collected();
     }
   }
 ).add(new Callable<Collection<Collected>>() {
     public Collection<Collected> call() throws Exception {
       return Arrays.asList(new Collected(), new Collected());
     }
 }).collect();
      Since java.util.concurrent.Callable is a FunctionalInterface, this can be simplified in Groovy: 
       def results = Lemming.makeLemming().add {
   new Collected()
 }.add {
   [new Collected(), new Collected()]
 }.collect()
      Parameters:
      < - T > the type of result to be collected
      Authors:
      Adam J. Weigold

      • Field Summary

          Fields 
          Modifiers Name Description
          static ExceptionStrategy  FAIL_ON_ANY_EXCEPTION An ExceptionStrategy that rethrows the exception given to it
          static ExceptionStrategy  QUIETLY_HANDLE_EXCEPTIONS An ExceptionStrategy that swallows all exceptions

      • Methods Summary

          Methods 
          Type Name and description
          Lemming<T> add(java.util.concurrent.Callable callable)
          Adds an additional callable who's results will be collected.
          java.util.Collection<T> collect()
          Invokes all the java.util.concurrent.Callables added and returns all the results as a collection.
          Lemming<T> failOnAnyException()
          Sets an ExceptionStrategy that will rethrow any Exception from an aborted java.util.concurrent.Callable which will cancel all unfinished java.util.concurrent.Callables and will rethrown the offending java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
          Lemming<T> failOnAnyTimeout()
          Sets an ExceptionStrategy that will rethrow from a timed out java.util.concurrent.Callable, effectively stopping any results to be returned from collect.
          static Lemming<T> makeLemming()
          Factory method to return a new Lemming instance
          Lemming<T> quietlyHandleAllExeptions()
          Sets an ExceptionStrategy that will swallow any Exception from an aborted java.util.concurrent.Callable which will allow all unfinished java.util.concurrent.Callables to continue to return results.
          Lemming<T> quietlyHandleAllTimeouts()
          Sets an ExceptionStrategy that will swallow from a timed out java.util.concurrent.Callable, effectively allowing any finished results to be returned from collect.
          Lemming<T> setDaemon(boolean daemon)
          Sets daemon or not for new threads created during collect.
          Lemming<T> setExceptionStrategy(ExceptionStrategy exceptionStrategy)
          Sets an ExceptionStrategy that will be invoked for any java.util.concurrent.Callables that abort due to throwing an Exception.
          Lemming<T> setExecutor(java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService executor)
          Overrides usage of the default executor service.
          Lemming<T> setPriority(int priority)
          Sets the priority for new threads created during collect.
          Lemming<T> setShutdownExecutorService(boolean shutdown)
          Sets if the java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService used during collect is shutdown.
          Lemming<T> setThreadCount(int threadCount)
          Sets the size of the thread pool to use when collecting.
          Lemming<T> setThreadFactory(java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory backingThreadFactory)
          Sets the backing java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory for new threads created during collect.
          Lemming<T> setThreadNameFormat(java.lang.String threadNameFormat)
          Sets the naming format to use when naming threads (java.lang.Thread#setName) which are created during collect.
          Lemming<T> setTimeout(long timeout)
          Sets the maximum time to wait for execution of all java.util.concurrent.Callables by the executor service in java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit#MILLISECONDS.
          Lemming<T> setTimeoutStrategy(ExceptionStrategy timeoutStrategy)
          Sets an ExceptionStrategy that will be invoked for any java.util.concurrent.Callables that are cancelled due to timing out.

      • Field Detail

        • public static final ExceptionStrategy FAIL_ON_ANY_EXCEPTION

          An ExceptionStrategy that rethrows the exception given to it

        • public static final ExceptionStrategy QUIETLY_HANDLE_EXCEPTIONS

          An ExceptionStrategy that swallows all exceptions

      • Method Detail

        • Lemming<T> add(java.util.concurrent.Callable callable)

          Adds an additional callable who's results will be collected.

          Parameters:
          callable - a callable that returns either or Collection
          Returns:
          this for the builder pattern

        • java.util.Collection<T> collect()

          Invokes all the java.util.concurrent.Callables added and returns all the results as a collection.

          Returns:
          a collection containing all the results from completed java.util.concurrent.Callables

        • Lemming<T> failOnAnyException()

          Sets an ExceptionStrategy that will rethrow any Exception from an aborted java.util.concurrent.Callable which will cancel all unfinished java.util.concurrent.Callables and will rethrown the offending java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException

          Returns:
          this for the builder pattern

        • Lemming<T> failOnAnyTimeout()

          Sets an ExceptionStrategy that will rethrow from a timed out java.util.concurrent.Callable, effectively stopping any results to be returned from collect.

          Returns:
          this for the builder pattern

        • static Lemming<T> makeLemming()

          Factory method to return a new Lemming instance

          Returns:
          a new Lemming instance

        • Lemming<T> quietlyHandleAllExeptions()

          Sets an ExceptionStrategy that will swallow any Exception from an aborted java.util.concurrent.Callable which will allow all unfinished java.util.concurrent.Callables to continue to return results.

          Returns:
          this for the builder pattern

        • Lemming<T> quietlyHandleAllTimeouts()

          Sets an ExceptionStrategy that will swallow from a timed out java.util.concurrent.Callable, effectively allowing any finished results to be returned from collect.

          Returns:
          this for the builder pattern

        • Lemming<T> setDaemon(boolean daemon)

          Sets daemon or not for new threads created during collect. This setting is ignored when using setExecutor.

          Parameters:
          daemon - whether or not new Threads created during collect will be daemon threads
          Returns:
          this for the builder pattern

        • Lemming<T> setExceptionStrategy(ExceptionStrategy exceptionStrategy)

          Sets an ExceptionStrategy that will be invoked for any java.util.concurrent.Callables that abort due to throwing an Exception. Note that any exceptions thrown from this handler will cancel all unfinished java.util.concurrent.Callables. Defaults to Lemming.QUIETLY_HANDLE_EXCEPTIONS

          Parameters:
          exceptionStrategy - the exception handler that for any java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException received from invoking a java.util.concurrent.Callable
          Returns:
          this for the builder pattern

        • Lemming<T> setExecutor(java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService executor)

          Overrides usage of the default executor service. Furthermore setting this will also cause collect to default to not shutting down the executor service if setShutdownExecutorService is not invoked.

          Setting this will cause settings to the following to be ignored as the java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory in the java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService is not overwritten:

          • setThreadCount
          • setThreadNameFormat
          • setDaemon
          • setPriority
          • setThreadUncaughtExceptionHandler
          • setThreadFactory
          Parameters:
          executor - the java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService to use during collection.
          Returns:
          this for the builder pattern

        • Lemming<T> setPriority(int priority)

          Sets the priority for new threads created during collect. This setting is ignored when using setExecutor.

          Parameters:
          priority - the priority for new Threads created with during collect
          Returns:
          this for the builder pattern

        • Lemming<T> setShutdownExecutorService(boolean shutdown)

          Sets if the java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService used during collect is shutdown. Defaults to true if setExecutor is not invoked, and false if it is.

          Parameters:
          shutdown - boolean setting for if collect should shutdown the java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService
          Returns:
          this for the builder pattern

        • Lemming<T> setThreadCount(int threadCount)

          Sets the size of the thread pool to use when collecting. Defaults to the number of java.util.concurrent.Callables added. This setting is ignored when using setExecutor.

          Parameters:
          threadCount - the size of the thread pool to use when collecting
          Returns:
          this for the builder pattern

        • Lemming<T> setThreadFactory(java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory backingThreadFactory)

          Sets the backing java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory for new threads created during collect. Threads will be created by invoking #newThread(Runnable) on this backing java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory. This setting is ignored when using setExecutor.

          Parameters:
          backingThreadFactory - the backing java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory which will be delegated to during thread creation.
          Returns:
          this for the builder pattern

        • Lemming<T> setThreadNameFormat(java.lang.String threadNameFormat)

          Sets the naming format to use when naming threads (java.lang.Thread#setName) which are created during collect. This setting is ignored when using setExecutor.

          Parameters:
          threadNameFormat - a String#format(String, Object...)-compatible format String, to which a unique integer (0, 1, etc.) will be supplied as the single parameter. This integer will be unique to the built instance of the ThreadFactory and will be assigned sequentially. For example, "rpc-pool-%d" will generate thread names like "rpc-pool-0", "rpc-pool-1", "rpc-pool-2", etc.
          Returns:
          this for the builder pattern

        • Lemming<T> setTimeout(long timeout)

          Sets the maximum time to wait for execution of all java.util.concurrent.Callables by the executor service in java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit#MILLISECONDS.

          Parameters:
          the - maximum time to wait
          Returns:
          this for the builder pattern

        • Lemming<T> setTimeoutStrategy(ExceptionStrategy timeoutStrategy)

          Sets an ExceptionStrategy that will be invoked for any java.util.concurrent.Callables that are cancelled due to timing out. Defaults to Lemming.QUIETLY_HANDLE_EXCEPTIONS

          Parameters:
          exceptionStrategy - the exception handler that for any java.util.concurrent.Callable that times out
          Returns:
          this for the builder pattern
